basics.name: Erin McGowan
basics.summary: Computer Science Ph.D. student at New York University with experience in data visualization, augmented reality, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.

work.name: Perceptually-enabled Task Guidance, VIDA Center, New York University
highlights: Worked with a team to develop ARGUS, a visual analytics system for multimodal sensor data used by researchers on the DARPA Perceptually-enabled Task Guidance project who seek to build an augmented reality (AR) assistant, using D3.js, JavaScript, and Python

Wrote paper as joint first author titled 'ARGUS: Visualization of AI-Assisted Task Guidance in AR' which earned a Best Paper Honorable Mention at IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics (VIS) 2023
Developed ARPOV, a tool for creating and analyzing panoramic mosaic-based visualizations of object detection outputs tailored to AR applications, using OpenCV.js, WebGL, Javascript, and Three.js

work.name: National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences
highlights: Developed a Glioblastoma-based Biomedical Profile Network (GBPN) of data relevant to brain tumors using Neo4j, Cypher, and Python
Identified existing drugs that could be repurposed to treat glioblastoma by performing network analysis on the GBPN using Gephi
Presented findings at the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences (NCATS) summer poster days

Wrote a paper as first author titled 'Integrative Rare Disease Biomedical Profile-based Network Supporting Drug Repurposing, A Case Study of Glioblastoma' (accepted to Orphanet Journal of Rare Diseases August 2023, read preprint here)

work.name: Cognitive and Data Science (CoDaS) Lab, Rutgers University - Newark
highlights: Worked with a team to develop a platform for conducting Theory of Mind (ToM) experiments via single and multiplayer games using Python, JavaScript, Heroku, Firebase, Redis, Socket.IO, FastAPI, and Git as part of the DARPA ASIST project
Wrote Python script to preprocess JSON files from Firebase database using NumPy and Pandas

work.name: Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) Program, Center for Discrete Mathematics and Theoretical Computer Science (DIMACS), Rutgers University - New Brunswick
highlights: Created a physics-driven convolutional neural network that predicts the porosity (a defect) of objects created via laser metal deposition (3D-printed metals) using Python, Keras, Scikit-learn, NumPy, Pandas, MATLAB, and Google Colab during the 2021 DIMACS REU Program (and continued to work with faculty mentor after duration of the REU program)
Investigated the impact of incorporating physics-informed constraints into the CNN architecture itself via custom loss functions
Published a paper as first author in Sensors journal titled 'A Physics-Informed Convolutional Neural Network with Custom Loss Functions for Porosity Prediction in Laser Metal Deposition' (read here)
Presented findings to REU administration, faculty mentors, and peers (presentation slides, research log, and further details found here)

education.institution: New York University Tandon School of Engineering
courses: Visualization for Machine Learning, Machine Learning
Design & Analysis of Algorithms I & II

education.area: Mathematics, minors in Computer Science & Comparative Literature
courses: Principles of Information and Data Management (SQL)
Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms (Java)
Introduction to Mathematical Reasoning (Discrete Structures I equivalent)
Mathematical Theory of Probability (Discrete Structures II equivalent)

awards.title: Future Leader Fellowship
awards.awarder: New York University Tandon School of Engineering
awards.summary: Most competitive (highest level) of Ph.D. full-funding at NYU Tandon.
